title: Quiz - Present Simple Affirmative & Daily Routines
description: Quiz sur le présent simple affirmatif et les routines quotidiennes

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
options: She wake up at seven o'clock.
She wakes up at seven o'clock.
She is wake up at seven o'clock.
She waking up at seven o'clock.
questions.explanation: With 'she' (third person singular), we add -s to the verb: 'wakes up'.

questions.question: How do you say 'Ils regardent la télé le soir' in English?
options: They watches TV in the evening.
They watch TV in the evening.
They are watch TV in the evening.
They watching TV in the evening.
questions.explanation: With 'they', we use the base form of the verb: 'watch' (no -s).

questions.question: What's the correct pronunciation of 'He works'?
questions.explanation: After the /k/ sound (voiceless), the -s is pronounced /s/: 'works' /wɜrks/.

questions.question: Which sentence describes a daily routine?
questions.explanation: Present simple with 'every morning' describes a regular habit/routine.

questions.question: Complete: 'My mother _____ dinner at six o'clock.'
questions.explanation: 'My mother' is third person singular, so we use 'cooks' (verb + s).
